intro: Scassellatia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf scassellatia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant exhibits variability in leaf shape and size, which is a notable botanical feature. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
